Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Palette for cosmetics
Description: Truncated diamond-shaped palette for cosmetics, carved from a translucent veined quartz. This type of artefact was used to crush green (malachite) and black (galena) mineral paints used as corporal ornament. Traces of these are often found on the object, however this is not the case here.
